title: Lessons Taught and Lessons Learned from Teaching Cryo-EM Courses
content: Single particle cryo-electron microscopy (cryo-EM) has emerged as a powerful and indispensable tool for high-resolution structure determination of cellular and extracellular biological macromolecules. Due to massive interest in this methodology across all fields of structural biology, there has been a surge of interest in gaining expertise in all aspects of cryo-EM structure determination. Here, we present the outcomes of intensive cryo-EM courses conducted at various institutes worldwide, including a notable 2-week program at Cold Spring Harbor Laboratory. These courses encompass comprehensive training in the theory, practice, and application of single particle cryo-EM techniques to diverse biological targets.
